title: Hakkies Husselman
text:
Dawid Husselman, better known as Hakkies Husselman (born 3 November 1972), is a <a href="Namibia">Namibia</a>n <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> former international player and a current coach. He played as a scrum-half.
Career.
Player.
He played for <a href="Western%20Province%20%28rugby%20team%29">Western Province</a> in <a href="South%20Africa">South Africa</a>. His first match for <a href="Namibia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Namibia</a> was at 3 July 1993, with <a href="Arabian%20Gulf%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">AGRU</a>, in a 64-20 win.
Husselman was present at the <a href="2003%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2003 Rugby World Cup</a> finals, playing three games. He had 10 caps for his country, with 4 tries scored, 20 points in aggregate.
Coach.
He latter became a coach, and was nominated coach of <a href="Namibia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Namibia</a> at 27 June 2007, for the <a href="2007%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">2007 Rugby World Cup</a> finals. Namibia lost all four games, but did a convincing performance at the 17-32 loss to <a href="Ireland%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Ireland</a>. He applied to remain in office after the World Cup but was dismissed.
